intro: Hieracium hoppeanum var. piloselliformis, commonly known as the hairy hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of ray and disk florets. The plant features a basal rosette of hairy, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine, white pubescence. It produces yellow flowers in the summer, which are surrounded by a series of bracts. This variant is distinguished by its dense, woolly foliage and is often found in dry meadows and rocky soils.
